question: Spread of chicken pox is maximum -
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Just before and after onset of rash o Communicable period (period of maximum infectivitv) in chicken pox is 2 days before to 5 days after onset of rash. Chicken poxo Causative agent- Varicella zoster virus (Herpes simplex type III). o Portal of entry- Respiratory tract or conjuctivao I. P. o Infectious periodo Secondary attack rate is higho Age group- 10-21 days.- 2 days before and 5 days after the onset of rash.- 90%- 5-9 Yrs. o C/Fs - has two stages. Pre-emptive stagefever, back pain, malaise, shivering. Eruptive stage. Rash is symmetrical, mostly on flexor surface. Centripetal in distribution. Mainly On trunk, less common on arms and leg. Palms and soles are not usually affected. There is rapid evolution of rash. Rash is plemorphic, that is, all stages of rash (Papule, vesicle and crusts) may be seen simultaneously. Disease is more severe in adults than in children.
opb: Just before and after onset of rash
opc: One week before onset of rash

question: A case of chicken pox should he isolated for a period of:
exp: Ans: A (6 days) Ref: Park 22nd edition pg 112. Explanation: Disease. Isolation. Measles. From onset of catarrhal stage through 3rd day of rash. Chicken pox. Until all lesions enisled about 6 days of rashH zoster6 days after onset of rash. Influenza3 days after onset. Polio2 weeks for adult, 6 weeks pediatrics. Hepatitis3 weeks. Pertussis4 weeks or until paroxysms ceases. Mumps. Until swelling subsides. TBUntil 3 weeks of effective chemotherapy. Chicken pox and herpes zoster have same period of isolation i. e. till 6 days of rash. Pertussis and mumps till the major symptom subsides i. e. paroxysmal cough in pertussis and swelling in mumps.
